question.title: Invalid use of argument matchers in junit jupiter 5 test
question.body:
@Test
       void updateKey_ShouldCallHqRestClient_WhenKeyIdIsNull() {
           // Arrange
           PlanKey planKeyWithNullId = createPlanKeyWithNullId();
    
           // Act
Ln 247     doNothing().when(hqRestClient).updateKey(isNull(), planKeyWithNullId);
           planKeyServiceImpl.updateKey(null);
    
           // Assert
           verify(hqRestClient, times(1)).updateKey(isNull(), eq(planKeyWithNullId));
       }
    
       private PlanKey createPlanKeyWithNullId() {
           PlanKey planKey = new PlanKey();
           planKey.setIdkey(null);
           return planKey;
       }

The above test throws this exception, and I'm unsure what needs to be done to resolve it.

org.mockito.exceptions.misusing.InvalidUseOfMatchersException: Invalid use of argument matchers! 2 matchers expected, 1 recorded: -> at com.homedepot.kimsbff.service.impl.PlanKeyServiceImplTest.updateKey_ShouldCallHqRestClient_WhenKeyIdIsNull(PlanKeyServiceImplTest.java:247)

PlanKeyServiceImpl.java method

public void updateKey (Long keyId){
        PlanKey planKey = new PlanKey();
        planKey.setIdkey(keyId);
        hqRestClient.updateKey(keyId, planKey);
    }

This is the feign client.

@FeignClient(value = "kimsHq", url = "${myassortment-kims-hq-url}", configuration = KimsHqFeignConfig.class, qualifiers = "KimsHqNonStreaming")
public interface HqRestClient {
   void updateKey(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody PlanKey planKey);
}
